New Records: Adolis Garcia became the first player in postseason history with a Golden Sombrero (four strikeouts) and a grand slam.
Adolis Garcia was the first player in LCS history to do so, and he was also the first to ever do it in a nine-inning postseason game.
Garcia was the first player in postseason history to strikeout four times and hit a grand slam.
Key Match Events: Adolis Garcia hit a grand slam in the top of the ninth inning with the bases loaded, one out, and his team holding a 5â€“2 lead.
Post-Match Reflections: Adolis Garcia's teammates expressed their admiration for his resilience and performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Minute Maid Park in Houston, Texas.
Others: The game was part of the 2023 ALCS between the Houston Astros and Texas Rangers.
Historical comparisons or records beyond: Adolis Garcia's feat was the first of its kind in LCS history.
Notable head-to-head statistics or uniqu: This was the first LCS involving two teams from the same state to go seven games.
